title: Mild earthquake rattles los angeles area awake; several aftershocks follow
author: Ap
text: LOS ANGELES - A mild earthquake and a series of aftershocks struck the Los Angeles area early today, jarring residents awake and shattering windows. There were no reports of injuries.    The quake happened at 1:26 a.m., and some residents reported feeling it for several minutes. There were several strong aftershocks.    "The shaking was very violent in the bed, and I weigh 300 pounds and so it's not easy to shake me," said John Kenney, who lives in Beverly Hills. "We live in a building that's very well built . . . and this thing rocked us pretty good."     The epicenter of the 3.3-magnitude earthquake was three miles northeast of Inglewood, said Nick Scheckel, a seismologist with the California Institute of Technology in Pasadena.    Los Angeles-area police received numerous reports, but none involving injuries. Los Angeles firefighters fanned out in "earthquake mode," searching the city for any problems.    An aftershock of 2.5-magnitude followed at 1:35 a.m., a couple of miles to the south of the first quake's epicenter.    "Ordinarily we wouldn't expect aftershocks from this small an earthquake," said John Minsch, a geophysicist with the U.S. Geological Survey National Earthquake Information Center, in Golden, Colo.    An unrelated earthquake struck at 1:33 a.m. in rural Landers, 110 miles east of Los Angeles, Scheckel said.
